(SANDY)

containing grit (= very small pieces of stone) or like grit: The last spoonfuls of the mussels' cooking liquid might be a bit gritty.gritty texture I didn't like the gritty texture of the sauce.

gritty adjective
(REAL)
usually approving showing the unpleasant or difficult features of something as they really are: gritty realism The novel was praised for its gritty realism and emotional intensity.gritty drama This is a gritty crime drama about corruption and greed.gritty portrayal "La Haine" is a gritty portrayal of life on a housing estate in Paris. I thought the style of the film was a bit slick, and I wanted something more gritty.
More examplesFewer examplesShe wanted to document the East End of London in all its gritty reality.He writes with the gritty authenticity that comes from actual combat experience.This is the gritty part of town.
